You will be able to:

Help Khaled Reach the Merry-Go-Round!
Khaled wants to go to the merry-go-round in the middle of the maze. Can you help him find the way? Let’s use an algorithm — that means a list of steps to follow!
What to do:
1. Look closely at the maze. 2. Use the cut-out arrows (or draw your own) to show Khaled’s moves:
↑ Move Forward ← Turn Left →Turn Right
3. Put the arrows in the right order — from START to FINISH. 4. Glue them in the boxes to show each move.
5. With your teacher, write the steps down like a story: (for example: Forward, Turn Right, Forward...)

Wrap-up Time!
Sequencing means putting steps in the right order.
Algorithm is a list of steps to solve a problem or do something.
• The X-axis is a line that goes side to side (like when you move left and right).
• The Y-axis is a line that goes up and down (like when you move up and down).

Unit Glossary
Keyword Definition
Sidewalks Are paths on the side of the road where people walk safely.
Sequence It means putting things in the right order from first to last.
Sprite Is a character or object in a computer game or animation.
The X-axis Is a line that goes side to side (like when you move left and right).
The Y-axis Is a line that goes up and down (like when you move up and down).
Mission Innovate
Design an Accessible Public Space.
Now It’s Your Turn
Choose a public space—like a crosswalk, park path, school gate, or bus stop—and redesign it to make it safe and easy for everyone to use, including people with disabilities. Think Critically by Answering These Questions:
• What makes it hard for some people to use this space right now?
• What changes can you add to help someone in a wheelchair, or with hearing or vision difficulties?
• How does your design help everyone move safely and independently?
• Can you use recycled or simple materials to build your model?
63

Project Guidelines
1
Choose a Place
Pick a public area where you think changes could help more people access it.
2
Research
Learn what features make places accessible—like ramps, sound signals, wide spaces, or tactile paths.
3
Design Use creative materials to build a model that shows your accessible design idea.
4
Present
Share your model and explain how it helps people with different abilities use the space safely and comfortably.
